result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:43 AM Defendant Michael T Sorenson not in court.  Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty in court for Michael T Sorenson as a Friend to the Court.  Attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case scheduled to address Competency Report filed 10/18/22 by Dr. Seipel.
Defendant was at Waukesha Mental Health yesterday and was under the impression he would be brought for court today. 
State does not request a capias as there may have been a miscommunication with Mendota. 
Atty Powers anticipates being retained next weeks.
Defense tolls time limits on Preliminary Hearing. 
Next hearing date found off the record.
Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Review hearing on November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
dated 10-18-2022;  completed by Dr. Matthew Seipel
Review hearing on November 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
signed by CC David Herring
To be signed by CC Herring - Order for Competency

1:17 PM Defendant Michael T Sorenson in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. The defendant indicates he made contact with his brothers and was provided access to his phone numbers and finances in order to retain private counsel. Given other pending matters for the defendant, the COURT ORDERS FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2). Court orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days. The Court will set this matter back before the Trial Court for review on competency. Bail remains as fixed.
Review hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:08 PM Defendant Michael T Sorenson in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant continues to state he does not wish to be represented by a Public Defender and wishes to seek private counsel but has not been given access to his personal cell phone to get contact numbers. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with 450 Sunnyslope Drive in the Village of Hartland/Victim A/Witness A/Witness B/Witness C/Witness D/Witness E/Witness F listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of 450 Sunnyslope Drive in the Village of Hartland, listed in the Criminal Complaint, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

1:27 PM Defendant Michael T Sorenson in court, in custody. Attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office, as the defendant refused. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and the Court reads the criminal complaint to the defendant on the record. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. The defendant does not wish to have a Public Defender for representation and intends to seek private counsel. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
